column2: The  5th  Defendant-Appellant  filed  a  statement  of  claim

column1: wherein it was contended that by virtue of an amicable partition entered
into by and between the co-owners of the corpus in dispute long prior to

column2: institution  of  this  action,  co-ownership  had  ceased  and  divided

column1: possession  of  the  defined  allotments  had  commenced  (according  to
Survey Plan No. 99, marked as 5V6). His position was that, in any event,
he had exclusively possessed certain divided allotments of land as owner
to  the  exclusion  of  others  and  had  thus  acquired  a  prescriptive  title
